revised_title: The Role of Trisporic Acid in Fungal Mating and Sexual Differentiation
tldr: This article discusses the biochemical functions of trisporic acid in plants, specifically its role as a sex hormone in the Mucorales fungi. Trisporic acid is involved in the formation of zygophores, increasing the rate of accumulation of terpenoids, and increasing its own rate of synthesis. It plays a crucial role in fungal mating and sexual differentiation, ensuring that the recipient fungus is only diverted from asexual reproduction when there is a good chance of successful mating with a compatible partner.
